carousel_items: Starts working in 1 to 2 hours depending on what dosage form you're taking.
Works best when taken regularly, even before symptoms are expected to appear.
Can make you feel dizzy or sleepy, so you can take it at bedtime.
Follow age-specific dosing and don't take more than recommended.
If symptoms get worse or you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Allegra is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions.
basics.bottom_line: Allegra relieves allergy symptoms without making you feel drowsy.
downsides: For some people, the effects Allegra has on allergies will wear off over time.
May not work as well as the first-generation antihistamines, like diphenhydramine (Benadryl).
The dose needs to be adjusted for people with kidney problems.

downsides_processed.orig: For some people, the effects Allegra has on allergies will wear off over time.

upsides: Relieves allergy symptoms, like sneezing, runny nose, and itching.
Approved to be used in kids and adults age 6 months and older.
Won't make you feel drowsy like some antihistamine medicines.
Available over-the-counter without a prescription.
Comes in many forms, such as a tablet, liquid, or quick-dissolving tablet.
It's okay to take with most other medications since it has very few interactions.

userStories.tip: I'm allergic to my cats and have sensitive skin. Taking these help immensely and is effective for the rest of the day.
I've taken it daily and it helps tremendously with my allergies. I also take Sudafed with it as needed.

Try it. I'd tried everything over 20 years; Ctirizine, Piriton, Benadryll, Local Honey, etc. This is the first thing I can honestly say has worked for me. I'm a chronic hay-fever case, so it feels like a small miracle for me.
Your website is out of date - it has been over the counter for at least a year.  My allergy doctor says it's safest because it does not affect your brain.

drugs.name: Allegra

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in 1 to 2 hours depending on what dosage form you're taking.
Works best when taken regularly, even before symptoms are expected to appear.
Can make you feel dizzy or sleepy, so you can take it at bedtime.
Follow age-specific dosing and don't take more than recommended.
If symptoms get worse or you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Allegra can lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Allegra can lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage from too much phenylalanine
risks_warnings.description: Some forms of Allegra contain aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, check to see which products you can use.

description_processed.orig: Some forms of Allegra contain aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, check to see which products you can use.

carousel_items: Starts working in an hour.
Take it once a day when needed.
Works the best if used regularly during allergy season.
Can give you a headache or diarrhea, but it rarely causes drowsiness or dizziness.

basics.benefits_moa: Desloratadine is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions.
basics.bottom_line: Desloratadine is a good option for once-daily allergy relief. It doesn't make you feel sleepy, but you need a prescription.
downsides: May not work as fast as the other antihistamines that make you sleepy (like Benadryl).
Not a good medication for pregnant women to take.

downsides_processed.orig: May not work as fast as the other antihistamines that make you sleepy (like Benadryl).
Not a good medication for pregnant women to take.

upsides: Relieves allergy symptoms like sneezing, runny nose, congestion, hives, or itchy skin.
Preferred for older people since it causes little to no drowsiness compared to other antihistamines like Diphenhydramine (Benadryl).
Works faster than other non-drowsy antihistamines like Loratadine (Claritin).
Side effects are rare and usually mild.
Available as a liquid or fast-dissolving tablet for people who don't like swallowing pills.

carousel_items: Take it only once a day.
Starts working in a few hours.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid possible side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead, which might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop might work better to help itchy or watery eyes.

clock.tip: Works slower when taken with food.
Works slower when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Claritin is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. Antihistamines can also make you sleepy, but Loratadine is a low-drowsiness version.
basics.bottom_line: Claritin is a once-daily allergy relief medication that doesn't make you feel sleepy.
downsides: For some people, its effectiveness on treating allergies wears off over time.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines (like Zyrtec or Benadryl) are more effective for them.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

downsides_processed.orig: For some people, its effectiveness on treating allergies wears off over time.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines (like Zyrtec or Benadryl) are more effective for them.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

upsides: Relieves allergy symptoms like sneezing and runny nose just as well as other antihistamines, but with less sedation (drowsiness).
Also treats hives and itchy skin.
Side effects are rare and usually mild.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Comes as a tablet, liquid, or quick-dissolving tablet.
Can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
Okay to take with most other medications because it doesn't have many interactions.

drugs.name: Claritin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it only once a day.
Starts working in a few hours.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid possible side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead, which might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop might work better to help itchy or watery eyes.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Claritin.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Claritin and stop using it if you have side effects.

This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Claritin and stop using it if you have side effects.

carousel_items: Levocetirizine can cause dizziness or drowsiness. Don't drink alcohol or take other allergy medications while on this.
It's recommended to take Levocetirizine in the evening.
Talk to your doctor if you experience urinary problems. You may need to switch to another allergy medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Levocetirizine is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions.
basics.bottom_line: Levocetirizine is good for treating allergy symptoms, but it can cause drowsiness.
downsides: Don't take Levocetirizine if you have poor kidney function.
Levocetirizine is similar to Zyrtec, another allergy medication, so if you can't take Zyrtec, you won't be able to take Levocetirizine.

downsides_processed.orig: Don't take Levocetirizine if you have poor kidney function.
Levocetirizine is similar to Zyrtec, another allergy medication, so if you can't take Zyrtec, you won't be able to take Levocetirizine.

upsides: Levocetirizine is taken once a day to help with allergy symptoms.
Available as a generic in both liquid and tablets.
Can be taken with or without food.
Children can take lower doses of Levocetirizine.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Levocetirizine can cause dizziness or drowsiness. Don't drink alcohol or take other allergy medications while on this.
It's recommended to take Levocetirizine in the evening.
Talk to your doctor if you experience urinary problems. You may need to switch to another allergy medication.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Levocetirizine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Levocetirizine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Levocetirizine is processed by the kidney. If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Don't use Levocetirizine if you have end-stage renal disease or are on hemodialysis. Children ages 6 months to 11 years with kidney problems shouldn't use Levocetirizine.

description_processed.orig: Levocetirizine is processed by the kidney. If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Don't use Levocetirizine if you have end-stage renal disease or are on hemodialysis. Children ages 6 months to 11 years with kidney problems shouldn't use Levocetirizine.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Levocetirizine. Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet. This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Levocetirizine and stop using it if you have side effects.

description_processed.orig: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Levocetirizine. Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet. This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Levocetirizine and stop using it if you have side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Urinary retention or blockage
risks_warnings.description: Levocetirizine can cause urinary retention. Be careful using this if you have certain risk factors like spinal cord lesions or prostate problems. Stop using it if you can't urinate as easily as before.

description_processed.orig: Levocetirizine can cause urinary retention. Be careful using this if you have certain risk factors like spinal cord lesions or prostate problems. Stop using it if you can't urinate as easily as before.

carousel_items: Starts working in a few hours. Only take it once a day.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid some of the side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead since it might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop instead can also work better to treat itchy or watery eyes.

basics.benefits_moa: Zyrtec is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. Antihistamines can also make you sleepy, but Zyrtec is a low-drowsiness version.
basics.bottom_line: Zyrtec is a once-daily allergy relief medication that won't make you feel too sleepy.
downsides: Although it works fast, its effectiveness wears off for some people over time.
Zyrtec can be slightly more sedating than Allegra or Claritin.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines, like Benadryl, are more effective for them than Zyrtec.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

downsides_processed.orig: Although it works fast, its effectiveness wears off for some people over time.
Zyrtec can be slightly more sedating than Allegra or Claritin.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines, like Benadryl, are more effective for them than Zyrtec.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

upsides: Zyrtec works as well as other antihistamines to treat sneezing and runny nose, but causes less sedation.
Works well to also treat hives and itchy skin.
Zyrtec is available over the counter without a prescription.
It comes as a tablet, liquid, and quick-dissolving tablet.
It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It's okay to take with most other medications because it has few drug interactions.
Most people don't get any side effects from Zyrtec.

upsides_processed.orig: Zyrtec works as well as other antihistamines to treat sneezing and runny nose, but causes less sedation.
Works well to also treat hives and itchy skin.
Zyrtec is available over the counter without a prescription.
It comes as a tablet, liquid, and quick-dissolving tablet.
It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It's okay to take with most other medications because it has few drug interactions.
Most people don't get any side effects from Zyrtec.

userStories.tip: If you have been suffering with allergies for day , you may need to take Zyrtec for a few days, even though many say it works within the first day.  It does if your just getting symptoms.  It will work though.
Take it at night. I found that it makes me slightly drowsy for 6-8 hours, so by taking it at night, I wake up without any drowsiness. The drowsiness is minimal for me, but noticeable
I often find that its suppression of allergy symptoms only lasts 12 hours,  rather than the 24 they claim.

Found out online that Zyrtec was going to be approved for chronic hives. Glory saints hallelujah I was so happy to discover it. Nothing else worked. Benedryl and other fast acting antihistimines were not making a dent, and slathering myself
Take it at night to help with drowsiness.
I appreciate that Zyrtec works without making me tired. I wish I had found the generic version at Costco more quickly!

I have multiple allergies & Zyrtec keeps them under control year-round (along with Singulaire for food allergies & Flonase for pollen.) I like it because it doesn't make me woozy the way Claritin does. Best taken right before bed.
A godsend. I'm not sure it's working as well after 10+ years.

drugs.name: Zyrtec

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in a few hours. Only take it once a day.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid some of the side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead since it might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop instead can also work better to treat itchy or watery eyes.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Zyrtec.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Zyrtec and stop using it if you have side effects.

description_processed.orig: Zyrtec can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Overdosage
risks_warnings.description: People with kidney or liver disease may need to take a lower dose of Zyrtec to prevent overdose. Talk with your doctor to be sure you are using the correct dose.

description_processed.orig: People with kidney or liver disease may need to take a lower dose of Zyrtec to prevent overdose. Talk with your doctor to be sure you are using the correct dose.
